title: "Movies" constructed geometric display face in NY Mag Fall Preview Issue
content:
Looking for a font ID for the font used in this Septembers NY Mag Fall Preview Issue. Thanks in advance!

danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202193218im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NYFONT_4195.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Federal Credit Union sans caps - Futura Cond (stretched) {Tiff, Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202193218/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36646 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 50s style script - New Berolina {Mike F, Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202193218/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36642 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content: I suppose you’re not asking about Mercury, used in the text portion, right? Well just in case, there you are.
It’s probably the same as [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202193218/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34758) but I haven’t found it yet. Someone else who knows more about this?
to clarify, I’m asking about the “MOVIES” font, but thanks for the other ID...
It would be very easy to customize Unit 3 Xtra to produce this.
Okay, I’m going to put my money on a customized version of the Robert Lowe font from T26, Unit.
